hometown.address: No. 15, Lane 399, Qingshan Road, Xindian District, New Taipei City, Taiwan

person_description.whoami: Welcome! I'm Cheng-En (Daniel) Lee, a tech enthusiast passionate about cybersecurity, frontend/backend development, and robotics. I love crafting meaningful projects that make a positive impact. In my spare time, I love to hack ethically, playing CTFs, and coding for fun.

experiences.name: Financial Cybersecurity Lab, National Taipei University of Technology (NTUT)
experiences.description: Took part in the Financial Cybersecurity Lab, where I contributed to research focused on devising a methodology for analyzing WIFI signals emitted by IoT devices and providing introductions of SDRs to new members of the lab.

experiences.name: b01lers Capture The Flag Team
experiences.description: Participated in the Capture the flag team as a member in Purdue University, which is currently ranked 7th in national standings.

experiences.name: Purdue Robomasters Club
experiences.description: Participated in the algorithm team of the Purdue Robomasters club, which is responsible for developing computer vision, auto aiming, and auto navigagion pipelines. I am involved in developing algorithms to assist auto aiming while aiming at a spinning robot.

experiences.name: ISC2 Certified in Cybersecurity Certification
experiences.description: Self-educated in security principles, incident response, access controls, network security, and security operations. Successfully passed the ISC2's CC certification exam by July 2024 and earned the certification.

experiences.name: EC-Council Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH) Certification
experiences.description: Participated in EC-Council's CEH training program, and passed the certification exam in July 2022.

experiences.name: The Data Mine, Purdue University, West Lafayette, IN
experiences.description: Collaborated with Knudsen Institute on analyzing trends in supply chains on industrial parts procurement in the automotive industry. I was trained to use R and Python to perform time series analysis, dynamic time warping, and ARIMA modeling, as well as storing and querying time series data with multiple databases.

projects.name: OpenTeam
projects.description: An online team management tool using React JS, Material UI, and Firebase. Featured functionalities include public and private teaming system, real time task management, and real time communication.

projects.name: Pathtracker Online
projects.description: An online robot path following simulator designed for VEX Robotics Competition, allowing developers to design and test autonomous routes virtually to boost the development process.

projects.name: AnyScrape
projects.description: A web scraper written in javascript, featuring custom filtering selection of tag name, tag attribute, tag location (with linear expressions implemented), and delay.

projects.name: Grouping Optimization
projects.description: An web application designed to experiment with group satisfaction optimization algorithms using multiple self-invented algorithms. Featured functionalities including classroom management system and group optimization algorithms.

projects.name: JavaCry Ransomware Framework
projects.description: A ransomware generation framework built entirely in Java, Featuring target directory encryption, secure management of encryption keys, and persistent reverse shell implant for Windows, Linux, and MacOS.

fun_fact: I actually cycled around my home country (Taiwan)
I passed the Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH) exam in a week
I have a sister who graduated from CMU: https://www.jessicajiaenlee.me/
task: Preparing for ISC2 Certified in Cybersecurity (CC) certification
Learning how to use GNU Radio on Hackrf to capture WIFI/Bluetooth or other RF signals
